revised_title: The Role of Rodent Acrosome and Perforatorium in Fertilization
tldr: The study investigates the role of the acrosome and perforatorium in the fertilization process in rodents. It is found that the acrosome becomes detached from living spermatozoa during passage through the female reproductive tract, allowing the perforatorium to expose and enable the spermatozoon to pass through the zona pellucida. The acrosome's function is likely to be the carriage of hyaluronidase, which helps the spermatozoon pass through the cumulus oophorus.
